result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Dwayne Roberson was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to 14CF66.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent in writing.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 36 mo.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

Reporter: Debra Jenson

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.

Reporter:  digital recorder - 1:43
  Def waived reading of Information.  Def by Counsel enters a plea of NG.  Motions due w/i 20 days; bail continued.

Defendant in court with Attorney Jessa K Nicholson.  Don J Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing signed.
Final pre-trial on May 6, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Bond Modification re. BMP.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 2:30 PM today.   In lieu of a Sobrietor or GPS monitoring, Bail Monitoring is requested to require Mr. Robertson to physically present himself at the offices of Bail Monitoring at two appointed times every day for purposes of administering a PBT to assure his complete sobriety, that if he fails to comply with the terms of the Bail Monitoring program, particularly as described immediately above, cash bail is automatically set in that event in the amount of $2000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court.  If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.  The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate in all respects consistent with the above terms and conditions of DCBM.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 1
Defn's - unable to fwd
